snippet: California, by far the nation's largest wine-producing state, has dropped legal action against the industry in exchange for an agreement by most wineries here to abandon the virtually universal practice of capping wine bottles with lead foil.   Th...
lead_paragraph: California, by far the nation's largest wine-producing state, has dropped legal action against the industry in exchange for an agreement by most wineries here to abandon the virtually universal practice of capping wine bottles with lead foil. The settlement, which was announced at a news conference on Friday by Attorney General Dan Lungren, also requires the California wine industry to spend $900,000 in penalties and on a consumer education campaign.

headline.main: California Wineries to Stop Using Lead Caps
